The reward pool is a pool found in the Ruins of Unkah, just outside the bank. After subduing Tempoross, players can fish with a big or small fishing net near the dock to get their rewards, granting 10 Fishing experience per reward. Attempting to fish from the reward pool without a net will cause the nearby Spirit Angler to offer a free small fishing net.

Fishing from the pool requires reward permits, which are obtained from subduing Tempoross. Players need to earn at least 2,000 points during a successful encounter to receive reward permits, starting at 1 and adding 1 per 700 point threshold (with a chance at rounding up). The reward pool's appearance changes as more reward permits are stored, and up to 8,000 reward rolls can be stored. The pool rewards are unaffected by skill boosts; e.g. it is not possible to catch manta rays if the player's base Fishing level is below 81. The rewards are determined by the player's Fishing level at the time of collection from the reward pool, not at the time of adding permits.

Rewards are collected from the reward pool at a rate of 1 reward for every 3 ticks (1.8 seconds). 100 rewards takes 3 minutes, and a full reward pool of 8,000 takes 4 hours to collect.

Fish[edit | edit source]

There is about a 90/160 chance to roll the fish sub-table. The exact drop rates on this sub-table are based on the player's base Fishing level; thus, a player with a higher Fishing level is more likely to receive higher level fish than a player with a lower Fishing level.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
26 March 2021
(update) 		Hotfix
  • The chance of receiving fish has been increased overall.
  • Some less desirable fish have been removed from the loot table.
  • The amount of junk items (ex. nails, feather, and bait) have been increased when looted, but the chance of receiving them has been reduced.
  • The amount of soaked pages have been slightly increased when looted.
  • Ultimate Ironmen can now store up to 8,000 reward credits like any other account.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Zuko's Twitter account. 11 May 2021. (Archived from the original on 11 May 2021.) Mod Zuko: "Attached image"

The '''reward pool''' is a pool found in the [[Ruins of Unkah]], just outside the bank. After subduing [[Tempoross]], players can fish with a [[big fishing net|big]] or [[small fishing net]] near the dock to get their rewards, granting 10 [[Fishing]] experience per reward. Attempting to fish from the reward pool without a net will cause the nearby [[Spirit Angler (Reward pool)|Spirit Angler]] to offer a free small fishing net.

Fishing from the pool requires reward permits, which are obtained from subduing Tempoross. Players need to earn at least 2,000 points during a successful encounter to receive reward permits, starting at 1 and adding 1 per 700 point threshold (with a chance at rounding up). The reward pool's appearance changes as more reward permits are stored, and up to 8,000 reward rolls can be stored. The pool rewards are unaffected by [[Temporary skill boost|skill boosts]]; e.g. it is not possible to catch manta rays if the player's base Fishing level is below 81. The rewards are determined by the player's Fishing level at the time of collection from the reward pool, not at the time of adding permits.

Rewards are collected from the reward pool at a rate of 1 reward for every 3 ticks (1.8 seconds). 100 rewards takes 3 minutes, and a full reward pool of 8,000 takes 4 hours to collect.
